{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3578972,"name":"John Fogarty","username":"JohnFogarty","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/johnfogarty/{size}/267052_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-03T03:51:44.777Z","cooked":"

Pretty simple question

Last season we used Pathplanner but made the change to choreo this year.

There was a way to specify non-zero path end velocity in Pathplanner but is this also possible while using choreo? We did this last year when we transitioned from a mid field path into note detection assisted PID and the non-zero velocity made things smoother.

We waste a bit of time during auto transitioning from a path end where the robot fully comes to rest then into our auto alignment to the reef or auto alignment to coral pieces.

We want some specific trajectory paths to be able to maintain a small velocity to smoothly transition between actions.

Choreo paths have a default stop point constraint at the end point, so you can remove this; if you care what the velocity is, you can add a max velocity constraint with a scope of the endpoint.
